posts.cooked:

Wanted to put this out there similar to other threads concerning other mechanisms teams are using this year. Now that most of us know that we want to deep climb, what solutions are teams planning to use after seeing Ri3Ds and OA teams?

It’s looking like deep climbing is going to take up a significant amount of space on a robot given the need to position that top of the cage above the CoM of a robot, and I’m interested in hearing the decisions that people are making and the reasons behind them.

185ae6c6e16047cd0a1a41806aaae637.name: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked: I was a big advocate for the donut climb at the beginning when we decided on climbing. But after working on packaging I regret my choices. I’m going to try to convince my team to switch to the everybot design this week.

posts.name: RoboGeek
posts.cooked: Just wanna say good on you for recognizing early pit falls and not digging a hole too deep for too long and you can still change the design for an alternative!

posts.name: Ari Steinfeld
posts.cooked: Am I allowed to vote in this if I’m one of the options on the list?

posts.name: Evan McDonald
posts.cooked: I’m not really allowed to disclose too many details, but we have a climb similar to Penn state’s. Rather than push off of the bottom plate however, we push ourselves up off of the ground, and have a latch to suspend ourselves off of the plate once our bell pan is above the bottom plate of the cage.

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked:
It’s an important skill for people to have IMO. I’ve been very locked in on specific designs in the past and I’ve realized sometimes you just have to let an idea go if it isn’t working.

Aaron_Li:

not digging a hole

In this instance I’m very much trying to avoid holes lol.

posts.name: Domtech
posts.cooked: In a manner that is compliant with rule R403 I hope:

posts.name: Evan McDonald
posts.cooked:
You know, I hope so too

I’m stress reading the rules again now…

Edit: we’re all good, crisis averted
